name: Unique Number
statement: You are given a positive number $$$x$$$. Find the smallest positive integer number that has the sum of digits equal to $$$x$$$ and all digits are distinct (unique).
inputFormat: The first line contains a single positive integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 50$$$) â€” the number of test cases in the test. Then $$$t$$$ test cases follow. Each test case consists of a single integer number $$$x$$$ ($$$1 \le x \le 50$$$).
outputFormat: Output $$$t$$$ answers to the test cases: if a positive integer number with the sum of digits equal to $$$x$$$ and all digits are different exists, print the smallest such number; otherwise print -1 .
